sentences.sContent: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.sCn: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.sContent: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.sCn: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.sContent: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.sCn: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.sContent: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.sCn: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.sContent: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.sCn: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

sentences.sContent: ...And you may even spot the highway or railroad from this point...
...Normal forgetting may even be a safety mechanism to ensure our brain doesn’t become too full...
...And such research might even suggest ways for us all to relive our past with greater clarity...
...What Barth wrote decades ago is even truer today...
...even eating! It was the first time...
...even the saddest moments can be washed away with time...
...or even what side of the train he was sitting on his journey to work...
...But there’s another one even more terrifying...

synos.tran: 变平；变得可比较；成为相等

phrases.pCn: 使平坦；使最后一行排足
不赚不赔；并列起跑；打成平手
conj. 即使那样；即使在那时
v. 使平坦；使均等；变正常

words.tran: 在晚上的；为晚上的；晚上用的
均匀地；平衡地；平坦地；平等地
晚上；傍晚；（联欢性的）晚会；后期

trans.tranOther: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying
